title: House Republicans Authorize Biden Impeachment Inquiry
description: Republicans in the US House voted Wednesday to formally authorize an impeachment inquiry into President Joe Biden, escalating a probe that has been underway for several months.

title: Supreme Court Wades Into 2024 Politics With Abortion, Jan. 6 Cases
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, Supreme Court correspondent Greg Stohr outlines two cases that will put the high court in the middle of the 2024 campaign . Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: US’s Sullivan Met With Saudi Crown Prince on Israel-Hamas War
description: US National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan met with Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman in Saudi Arabia on Wednesday to discuss the ongoing Israel-Hamas war, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Trump Wins Pause in DC Election Case During Immunity Appeal
description: A federal judge in Washington granted Donald Trump’s request to pause the 2020 election obstruction case scheduled for trial March 4 while he presses a claim for sweeping immunity against criminal charges.

title: Argentina November Inflation Quickened Before Milei Devaluation
description: Argentina’s inflation soared above 160% in November ahead of President Javier Milei’s massive currency devaluation that’s likely to accelerate price increases ever further this month.

title: Venezuela Nearly Doubles Budget as Maduro Prepares for Election
description: Venezuela nearly doubled its 2024 budget to 730 billion bolivars or the equivalent of $20.5 billion as President Nicolás Maduro prepares for presidential elections and forecasts additional spending for the defense of the Essequibo territory.

title: Republican Senators Say They’re Weighing Biden’s Immigration Offer
description: President Joe Biden has offered changes to US border policy that raises the prospects of a bipartisan deal on immigration and aid to Ukraine, Republican senators said Wednesday.

title: South Africa Takes a Major Step Toward Fixing Work Visa Mess
description: South Africa’s home affairs minister signed planned changes to work permit regulations aimed at fixing a bureaucratic morass that’s frustrating the country’s biggest investors and exacerbating a skills crisis, people familiar with the situation said.

title: Sunak’s Allies Sense Tory Right Missed Best Shot at Migration Bill
description: Rishi Sunak was visibly relieved after staving off a rebellion on the right of his Conservative Party to win a vote on his signature immigration policy. The UK prime minister hugged his chief political enforcer in Parliament, and jubilant aides celebrated with whiskey late into Tuesday evening.

title: Eskom Asks Government to Take Stake in Company to Ease Debt Payments
description: Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd., South Africa’s indebted state power utility, told investors it has asked the National Treasury to convert 16 billion rand ($840 million) of bailout funds into equity.

title: A Different Danger: The Readout With Allegra Stratton
description: Today we expected to be talking about last night.

title: EU Unlocks €10 Billion of Funding for Hungary in Boost for Orban
description: The European Union decided to release more than €10 billion ($10.8 billion) of aid earmarked for Hungary, a major win for Prime Minister Viktor Orban ahead of a crucial summit on Ukraine that the nationalist leader is threatening to torpedo.

title: US Lawmakers Target China Through Export, Sanctions Bills
description: A House panel moved toward advancing four measures intended to make the US Commerce Department tougher on China, including bills that would mandate more transparency about licensing decisions and give other agencies more say in which technologies and firms are restricted.

title: Senegal Prime Minister Likely to Win Presidency, Eurasia Says
description: Senegalese Prime Minister Amadou Ba is likely to win presidential elections scheduled for February with the backing of the ruling coalition and President Macky Sall’s endorsement, Eurasia Group said.

title: South Africa Aims to Fire Up Economic Growth With Port, Rail Revival
description: South Africa’s government and the business community set a target of boosting the economic growth rate by as much as six percentage points by fixing the country’s collapsing ports and freight-rail network.

title: Hunter Biden Challenges GOP, ‘I Am Here’ to Testify Publicly
description: Presidential son Hunter Biden admitted to making “mistakes” in his finances but said his father had no involvement in his business dealings.

title: Sweden Must ‘Strangle’ Criminal Economy, Finance Minister Says
description: Sweden’s government, authorities and banks must cooperate to strangle a criminal sub-economy that is fueling a surge in gun violence, the country’s finance minister said.

title: Trump Opposes Fast-Tracking Appeal of Immunity Loss in DC Case
description: Donald Trump’s lawyers are opposing efforts by Special Counsel Jack Smith’s office to speed up the fight over whether he’s immune from federal prosecution for his efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election.

title: Trump’s Civil Fraud Trial to Resume in January as Primaries Start
description: New York state’s civil fraud trial against Donald Trump is going on hiatus for the rest of the year, with the judge potentially returning a verdict on the case as the first presidential nominating contests kick off in January.

title: Merry Making: Starmer's Christmas Criticisms
description: Get caught up on the day’s political news

title: Bulgaria dismantles a Soviet army monument that has dominated the Sofia skyline since 1954
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria (AP) — Bulgaria on Wednesday began dismantling a monument to the army of the Soviet Union that dominated the skyline of the capital, Sofia, for nearly 70 years and was widely seen as a symbol of Russia’s influence in the Balkan country.

title: Sunak Says More Humanitarian Pauses ‘Urgently’ Needed in Gaza
description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said more pauses are “urgently needed” in the Israel-Hamas war to alleviate the humanitarian situation in Gaza, while also calling for a “sustainable cease-fire.”

title: Wilders-Led Dutch Government May Cut Military Support to Ukraine
description: Dutch far-right politician Geert Wilders said the Netherlands should cut its military support to Ukraine as Kyiv struggles to secure aid from key Western allies.

title: Hungary Sees ‘Horrible’ Economic Fallout Without EV Subsidies
description: Hungary said the European Union should reconsider a return to tighter fiscal policy and allow for higher subsidies for the electric-vehicle industry to ward off crushing competition from the US and China.

title: Drakeford Triggers Contest to Replace Him as Welsh First Minister
description: Welsh First Minister Mark Drakeford has announced he is standing down as Labour leader, triggering the contest to find his successor.

title: Mark Drakeford Steps Down as First Minister of Wales
description: Mark Drakeford has said he will stand down as First Minister of Wales, saying: "When I stood for election as leader of Welsh Labour, I said I would stand down during the current Senedd term. That time has now come."

title: Sunak No Longer More Popular Than Party Among Voters, Poll Says
description: When Rishi Sunak came to power in the UK just over a year ago, he was seen as an electoral boon to his ailing Conservative Party. No longer.

title: The World Takes a Turn Away From Fossil Fuels
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: German Coalition to Stick With Debt Restrictions Next Year
description: Germany’s ruling coalition agreed not to suspend restrictions on new borrowing again next year as part of an accord struck overnight on a revised 2024 budget, according to people familiar with the deal.

title: Yandex Founder Seeks Sanctions Removal After Condemning Russia’s Invasion
description: Yandex NV co-founder Arkady Volozh shouldn’t have been sanctioned after Vladimir Putin’s invasion of Ukraine, as he was never close to the Russian president and has blasted Russia’s aggression toward its neighbor, a European Union court was told.

title: How Two Unpopular Candidates Ended Up Dominating the 2024 Race
description: In this episode of The Big Take podcast, we look at why President Joe Biden and Donald Trump don’t face any serious challengers.

title: Thai Opposition Lawmaker Sentenced to Jail Over Monarchy Insults
description: A Thai criminal court sentenced an opposition lawmaker to six years in jail under the country’s royal defamation law, as challenges mounted against the party that was blocked from power after winning a general election earlier this year.

title: Ukraine and Argentina Top Amundi Emerging-Market Favorites List
description: Europe’s biggest money manager is counting on Donald Trump’s return and Javier Milei’s “shock therapy” to pay off big for bond investors in Ukraine and Argentina, in a bet that right-wing populism will determine the most compelling stories in emerging markets next year.

title: Xi Asks Vietnam to Stop Outsider Attempts to ‘Mess Up’ Region
description: Chinese President Xi Jinping wrapped his first visit to Vietnam in six years by calling on the Southeast Asian country to stop external forces from causing problems in the Asia-Pacific.

title: Pakistan Court Charges Ex-PM Imran Khan of Violating Secrecy Law
description: A Pakistan court charged former prime minister Imran Khan of violating the Official Secrets Act when he allegedly made public a secret diplomatic cable while in office, adding to his legal woes and further jeopardizing his chances of contesting national elections.

title: US Sanctions Russia’s Wartime Dealmaker in Strike at ‘Oligarch’
description: The US sanctioned businessman Ivan Tavrin, who’d benefited from his position as an unpenalized investor to become Russia’s biggest wartime dealmaker.

title: Why South Africa Is Mired in an Electricity Crisis: QuickTake
description: South Africa has been dogged since 2008 by rolling blackouts that have grown steadily worse despite repeated government pledges to end them. The country’s old and poorly maintained power stations run by debt-stricken state utility Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd. can’t keep up with demand, and plans to buy more electricity from private producers have been delayed by grid constraints and court action. With the governing party in danger of losing its majority in 2024 elections, President Cyril Ramaphosa ap

title: India Parliament’s Lower House Adjourned After Security Breach
description: The lower house of India’s parliament was adjourned after a likely security breach on Wednesday, that coincides with the anniversary of a terrorist attack two decades ago.

title: Iranian Ship Hidden in Plain Sight Nears End of Sanctions Limbo
description: An Iranian container ship stuck in a Turkish port for three years is preparing to leave in a case that shows the reach — and limits — of sanctions at sea.

title: Hungary Ready for Financial Compromise on Ukraine, PM Orban Says
description: Hungary is ready for a financial compromise on European Union aid to Ukraine but will torpedo efforts to start EU membership talks with Kyiv, Prime Minister Viktor Orban said.

title: EU to Create Anti-Money Laundering, Anti-Terror Financing Body
description: The European Union is taking steps to create a new authority aimed at countering money laundering and terrorism financing, following a provisional agreement between the Council and the bloc’s Parliament.

title: German Ruling Coalition Seals Deal on Revised 2024 Budget
Russia Targets Kyiv in Missile Attack After Zelenskiy’s US Visit
description: Ukraine said Russia targeted its capital city with ballistic missiles for a second time in three days as President Volodymyr Zelenskiy visited the US to plead with lawmakers to unlock aid for the war effort.

title: Nordic Leaders Warn Failure to Back Ukraine Will Erode Security
description: Nordic leaders are urging other nations to commit to a united front in supporting Ukraine against Russia’s war, warning that a failure to help Kyiv risks worsening the security in Europe for decades.

title: China’s Xi Publicly Skips Day 2 of Economic Event For First Time
description: President Xi Jinping publicly skipped half of a key annual economic meeting for the first time, as the Chinese leader continues to break Communist Party norms in his precedent-defying third term.

title: EU Isolation and Russian Overtures Threaten Western Balkan Peace
description: Last month, Milorad Dodik, the Russia-backed leader of Bosnia’s Serb population, appeared on local television and announced his plans to become the first president of a Bosnian Serb breakaway state.

title: UK Builders Are Going Rogue But Fewer Offenders Are Being Caught
description: Underfunded planning departments are seen at the heart of failings

title: Poland’s New Cabinet of Donald Tusk Mixes Novice and Pros
description: Poland’s incoming government under Donald Tusk will have some heavy lifting to do after eight years of nationalist rule, from mending fences with the European Union to restoring the independence of courts.

title: Biden 2020 Donor Mike Novogratz to Fundraise for Dean Phillips
description: A prominent donor to Joe Biden’s 2020 campaign has thrown his support to the president’s longshot primary challenger Representative Dean Phillips, according to a person familiar with the matter.

title: DeSantis Says US Should Put Aid to Israel Before Ukraine
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis told voters at a town hall in Iowa that Israel should take priority over Ukraine when it comes to the US supporting nations at war.

title: ‘There Is No More Money’: Argentina Begins Economic Shock Remedy
description: Economy chief Luis Caputo spent the better part of his first televised address explaining how Argentina got into such a dire economic situation: an “addiction” to debt, for which the only medicine is a shock treatment.

title: Japan’s Kishida Faces Biggest Political Scandal in Three Decades
description: Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida is struggling to rein in the widest financial scandal to hit his long-ruling Liberal Democratic Party in more than three decades, as it upends the balance of power among the rival factions that vie to set its policy and pick leaders.

title: Anwar Urges Caution After Sultan’s Government Comments, Report Says
description: Malaysia’s prime minister urged caution after the country’s incoming king this weekend set teeth on edge in Kuala Lumpur and beyond with suggestions that the monarchy ought to have a bigger say in federal government matters.

title: Pakistan Scraps Nawaz Sharif’s Last Graft Sentence as Polls Near
description: A Pakistan court overturned a corruption conviction for former prime minister Nawaz Sharif, removing a major hurdle in his participation in next year’s elections where he is widely seen as a top contender.

title: Guatemala President Insists Peaceful Transition Will Happen
description: Guatemala President Alejandro Giammattei said a peaceful transition of power will take place on Jan. 14 as he seeks to calm fears as prosecutors probe this year’s election results.

title: Zelenskiy’s US Visit Falls Short as Aid for War Still Stalled
description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy pleaded with US lawmakers to approve $61 billion in aid vital to his war effort but left Washington with no clear commitment that his most important ally will keep up support as his fight against Russia’s invasion drags toward a third year.
